title: 2022 Aston Martin DBS Superleggera Coupe
description: This 2022 Aston Martin DBS Superleggera coupe is finished in Racing Green over Onyx Black leather upholstery and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 5.2-liter V12 linked with an eight-speed automatic transaxle and a limited-slip differential with torque vectoring. The car rides on an adaptive suspension along with 21″ twin-spoke alloy wheels and is equipped with carbon-ceramic brakes. Additional details include carbon-fiber exterior and interior trim along with a surround-view camera system, navigation, Bang & Olufsen BeoSound Audio, and heated and ventilated seats. Acquired by the selling dealer in October 2024, this DBS Superleggera has 764 miles and is now offered with a photocopy of the window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, two fob keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 2022 Aston Martin DBS Superleggera Coupe at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #171,132.
text: This 2022 Aston Martin DBS Superleggera coupe is finished in Racing Green over Onyx Black leather upholstery and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 5.2-liter V12 linked with an eight-speed automatic transaxle and a limited-slip differential with torque vectoring. The car rides on an adaptive suspension along with 21″ twin-spoke alloy wheels and is equipped with carbon-ceramic brakes. Additional details include carbon-fiber exterior and interior trim along with a surround-view camera system, navigation, Bang & Olufsen BeoSound Audio, and heated and ventilated seats. Acquired by the selling dealer in October 2024, this DBS Superleggera has 764 miles and is now offered with a photocopy of the window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, two fob keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title. The DBS shares its aluminum structure with the DB11 and features Superleggera-specific carbon-fiber bodywork including the front splitter, hood, fender louvers, trunk lid, and rear diffuser. This example is finished in Racing Green and features LED headlights, smoked LED taillamps, and quad-tip exhaust outlets exiting through the rear fascia. Paint protection film has been applied to the full exterior, including the front splitter, rear diffuser, and trim. Optional forged 21″ twin-spoke wheels are finished in gloss black and wrapped in 265/35 front and 305/30 rear Pirelli P Zero tires. Stopping power is provided by black Aston Martin–branded calipers over carbon-ceramic discs at all four corners. The car is further  equipped with adjustable dampers and features GT, Sport, and Sport+ driving modes. The heated, ventilated, and 12-way-adjustable front seats feature Aston Martin logos on the backrests and are trimmed in Onyx Black leather that extends to the dashboard, center console, headliner, and door panels. Carbon-fiber trim accents the cabin, and additional appointments include Keyless Go with a crystal ignition button as well as a push-button gear selector, dual-zone automatic climate control, a surround-view camera system, parking sensors, Bang & Olufsen BeoSound Audio, and an 8″ display screen with navigation. The multifunction steering wheel is wrapped in leather and equipped with gearshift paddles. It fronts a 12″ color TFT LCD cluster with a central tachometer and a speedometer flanked by a pair of configurable displays. The digital odometer indicates 764 miles. The twin-turbocharged 5.2-liter V12 was factory rated at 715 horsepower and 664 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a carbon-fiber driveshaft and a rear-mounted ZF eight-speed automatic transaxle with a limited-slip differential. The car is further equipped with Dynamic Torque Vectoring. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage. You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. html:
This 2022 Aston Martin DBS Superleggera coupe is finished in Racing Green over Onyx Black leather upholstery and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 5.2-liter V12 linked with an eight-speed automatic transaxle and a limited-slip differential with torque vectoring. The car rides on an adaptive suspension along with 21″ twin-spoke alloy wheels and is equipped with carbon-ceramic brakes. Additional details include carbon-fiber exterior and interior trim along with a surround-view camera system, navigation, Bang & Olufsen BeoSound Audio, and heated and ventilated seats. Acquired by the selling dealer in October 2024, this DBS Superleggera has 764 miles and is now offered with a photocopy of the window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, two fob keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.

The DBS shares its aluminum structure with the DB11 and features Superleggera-specific carbon-fiber bodywork including the front splitter, hood, fender louvers, trunk lid, and rear diffuser. This example is finished in Racing Green and features LED headlights, smoked LED taillamps, and quad-tip exhaust outlets exiting through the rear fascia. Paint protection film has been applied to the full exterior, including the front splitter, rear diffuser, and trim.

Optional forged 21″ twin-spoke wheels are finished in gloss black and wrapped in 265/35 front and 305/30 rear Pirelli P Zero tires. Stopping power is provided by black Aston Martin–branded calipers over carbon-ceramic discs at all four corners. The car is further  equipped with adjustable dampers and features GT, Sport, and Sport+ driving modes.

The heated, ventilated, and 12-way-adjustable front seats feature Aston Martin logos on the backrests and are trimmed in Onyx Black leather that extends to the dashboard, center console, headliner, and door panels. Carbon-fiber trim accents the cabin, and additional appointments include Keyless Go with a crystal ignition button as well as a push-button gear selector, dual-zone automatic climate control, a surround-view camera system, parking sensors, Bang & Olufsen BeoSound Audio, and an 8″ display screen with navigation.

The multifunction steering wheel is wrapped in leather and equipped with gearshift paddles. It fronts a 12″ color TFT LCD cluster with a central tachometer and a speedometer flanked by a pair of configurable displays. The digital odometer indicates 764 miles.

The twin-turbocharged 5.2-liter V12 was factory rated at 715 horsepower and 664 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a carbon-fiber driveshaft and a rear-mounted ZF eight-speed automatic transaxle with a limited-slip differential. The car is further equipped with Dynamic Torque Vectoring.

The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.
